desc: WHSC1, a histone methyltransferase, is mutated in blood cancers.

The WHSC1 gene encodes the NSD2 histone lysine methyltransferase. WHSC1 specifically methylates the H3K36 residue of histones and promotes an open chromatin state that favors gene transcription (PMID: 22099308, 20974671, 19808676). Activation of WHSC1/NSD2 enhances an oncogenic H3K36me2-dependent transcriptional program that includes genes such as MET and PAK1, and activates tumorigenesis in in vitro and in vivo cancer models (PMID: 19808676, 24076604). WHSC1 is mutated in acute lymphoblastic leukemia and Mantle cell lymphoma (PMID: 24076604, 24145436).
